name: 數位華語教學專題研究
description: This course aims at leading students to the field of digital Mandarin teaching through the introduction to the learning theories, hands-on experience in using the state-of-the-art technologies and its application in CFL/CSL teaching, seminar talks, etc. Classes will be blended; a portion of face-to-face instruction will be replaced by web-based online teaching, either synchronous or asynchronous.
goals: Develop students ability to read articles related to digital Chinese language teaching
Enhance students ability to conduct research in digital Chinese language teaching through technologies
syllabus:
Week 1 (02/22)Introduction

Week 2 (03/01)Peace Memorial Day

Week 3 (03/08)Learning Theories-1

Week 4 (03/15)Learning Theories-2

Week 5 (03/22)Learning Theories-3

Week 6 (03/29)Educational Free Software

Week 7 (04/05)Tomb Sweeping Day

Week 8 (04/12)Teaching Plan Design-1

Week 9 (04/19)Google for Education-1

Week 10(04/26)Google for Education-2

Week 11(05/03)Teaching Plan Design-2

Week 12(05/10)Social Media and Apps

Week 13(05/17)Teaching Plan Design-3

Week 14(05/24)Virtual Reality-1

Week 15(05/31)Virtual Reality-2

Week 16(06/07)Teaching Plan Design-4

Week 17(06/14)Dragon Boat Festival

Week 18(06/21 )Seminar Talks Participation

methodologies.note: To introduce the basic learning theories
To divide students in small groups of 4 or 5 and proceed small group discussion on and design the teaching plans
To have students present their teaching plans

grading.note: Students should actively engage in in-class discussion and participate in the learning activities led by the instructor.
Each group should give oral presentations of their group design of teaching plans.
